events.name: SARTS QSO Event - SG 50 Celebrations
events.description: It's Singapore's 50th year of independence! As such, some members of SARTS will be hosting a station to celebrate! Come join us as we celebrate with the nation and the rest of the world through the fun of Amateur Radio!

events.name: Fusion 360
events.description: Fusion 360 by Badari Hiriyur Fusion 360™ is the first 3D CAD/CAM tool of its kind, connecting your entire product development process in a single cloud-based tool. Which will also help you to connect to your 3D printer & bring your ideas in to real life. After this talk, you will understand the basics of 3D modeling technology & cloud based technology workflow. Participants are encouraged tobring a laptop with Fusion 360 software installed. at http://www.autodesk.com/products/fusion-360/overview Register Here https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-aug-meeting-2015-tickets-18001222140

events.name: Data Mining With R (Workshop III)
events.description: Hello everyone, the upcoming Data Mining with R workshop will be talking about clustering with iterative process. Clustering can be considered the most important unsupervised learning problem. The goal of clustering is to determine the intrinsic grouping in a set of unlabeled data. In this talk, Teck Por will be showing three clustering algorithms with iterative process: K-means clustering, EM clustering and kernel K-means clustering. After the introduction of the 3 popular clustering algorithms, he will also share his experience on fine tuning the parameters to address real problems, such as determine the number of clusters. Of course, in the end, the code walkthrough session will also give you an idea of how to apply these algorithms with R.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: PyLadies August Meetup
events.description: Our July meetup was a huge success, but not everything was perfect and  we got very valuable feedback from our attendees. We will incorporate that feedback into our slides and repeat the meetup once more in August. We had many people on the waiting list and some couldn't make it last minute - this is your second chance!! Please only fill out this form if you really intend to come. We have only 40 seats available and we want to reach as many women as possible. A pros pros women: This is a PyLadies workshop and obviously it is aimed to mentor female developers in Singapore. We are in the early stages of building up this community and the demand seems to be huge, therefore, due to limited slots available, we cannot accept RSVPs from male developers, YET.
events.location: PayPal office at 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 7, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985

events.name: Meteor August Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our August MeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! *** Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Creating a Meteor application for Android APK using phonegap - Albert Tirtohadi #2 - Meteor Schema and Autoform - Dan Tran #3 - Meteor Clinic: - If anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question ) #4 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #5 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Please note we may be at the new space which is at #02-01, in Bk71 Organizers : Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur Venue sponsor: Plug-In@Blk71: http://www2.blk71.com Please contact us to sign up to our newsletter for future events...

events.name: Null Singapore Aug Meetup: News Bytes , Deep Dark Web &  Bitcoin
events.description: **null meets are free for anyone to attend. There are absolutely no fees. Just come with an open mind and willingness to share and learn** Agenda: Introduction & Networking : 15 mins News Bytes by Randen : 15 mins Each Talks : 45 Mins Red Riding Hood in the Deep Dark Woods by Fadli Bitcoin and its role in ensuring Privacy by Dias Map: Please see the meetup map or follow below street view map. https://www.google.com/maps/@1.280919,103.847042,3a,75y,317.56h,95.79t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sVb_jjHjK7OEtOoaHIfwSpQ!2e0?hl=en Streetdirectory: http://www.streetdirectory.com/sg/car-park-amoy-street-a0006/30317_1.html Landmark: Its opposite to Car Park Via MRT: ThoughtWorks(TW) office is 3 mins away from Telok Ayer MRT (DT, purple line) . TW office is 7 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT (green line), take Exit G and take a left till you reach a right turning road and look for 87 B. Abstract of the talk(s) given by respective speakers News Bytes: It will cover the latest news on information security that were in headlines in last month. Red Riding Hood in the Deep Dark Woods We have all heard about the Deep and Dark Web but how many of us have actually explore it and how many of us are already inside it yet we do not realize it? From selling of personal data to credit card data, these are just a glimpse of what is happening in the dark net. This talk aims to share some of the 'interesting' things found during my exploration in the deep web and why the deep dark web is an interesting and at the same time a very dangerous place to be. Bitcoin and its role in ensuring Privacy Bitcoin is pseudo anonymous crypto currency, this talk will briefly discuss Bitcoins for the uninitiated and then move onto interesting applications for decentralization and privacy, such as its application in Data Storage, Networks etc. Speaker(s) Bio: Fadli is a cyber security enthusiast who loves to read all things security. Currently working at Silverskin Technologies, Fadli is a bookworm who loves to read, blog and a sucker for security conferences. He has written various security articles and has spoken in conferences worldwide. Dias is an Engineer working with Quantified Assets in Singapore and works on giving digital life to asset classes that are believed to be dead. He has been messing around with stuff since he was a kid and loves challenges. He has had extensive experience with large scale database systems early in his career, and has always been interested in Security. Currently, engaged in debugging and resolving his newborn baby's issues. Randen is a software engineer having 12 years of experience in working on both Enterprise/Proprietary and Open Source Technologies. Currently he is more involve in developing API and mobile applications. He had been interested with security and applies it to how he is developing his applications. Follow us on twitter @nullsingapore and fb at facebook.com/nullsingapore.
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: UNited We Hack
events.description: Wanting to put your skills & ideas to use and do some good? Here’s a chance to win $1500 AND mentorship programme access at the same time! Join us at UNited We Hack on the 15th & 16th August to hack out innovative solution to help empower women both financially & socially! Be our 80th sign up to win a Jabra speaker & 140th signup to win a Pebble watch even before the hack starts! Get your FREE tickets at bit.ly/UNitedhack NOW On August 15th and 16th, join us at Microsoft Singapore for a 24 hour hackathon to innovate in the field of women’s financial and economic empowerment. This hackathon is open to men and women who are interested in using the latest API’s to create cutting edge solutions around gender equity and financial equality. Get your FREE tickets at bit.ly/UNitedhack NOW Winning teams would not only receive cash prizes but also gain access to incubation & mentorship programmes, ensuring that your ideas are brought to the real world! Join us to be part of an amazing cause! Come even if you only want to look at the pretty judges.

events.name: NoSql night!
events.description: We will be glad to welcome you for a NoSql night. Clarence Tauro from CouchBase will be traveling to Singapore on that week and will be our guest speaker. We have interviewed Clarence here. Abstract NoSQL databases offer a significant change to how enterprise applications are built, challenging to two-decade hegemony of relational databases. The question people face is whether NoSQL databases are an appropriate choice, either for new projects or to introduce to existing projects. This talk will give a rapid introduction to NoSQL databases: where they came from, the nature of the data models they use, and the different way you have to think about consistency and polyglot persistence. It will then dive into Couchbase, which is a high-performance NoSQL distributed database with a flexible data model. Finally it will discuss how to integrate CouchBase with Spring using the Spring Data Couchbase project. ============================================ Note: if you are interested to go for CouchBase training in Singapore, all information is available here: http://training.couchbase.com/instructor-led-training/cd220-developing-couchbase-nosql-applications
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: [TICKETS SOLD OUT!] Ryoji Ikeda: Supercodex Thursday 20 August, 8pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 Concept, composition: Ryoji Ikeda Computer graphics, programming: Tomonaga Tokuyama PREPARE TO BE IMMERSED IN A MULTI-SENSORIAL EXTRAVAGANZA. Sonic artist, visual artist, electronic composer and computer-musician in one, Ryoji Ikeda has gained international renown for his provocative work combining visuals and sound. ArtScience Museum is delighted to host the performance of Ikeda’s supercodex [live set], which reworks musical concepts from Ikeda’s 2013 superposition piece, which investigates how we understand the reality of nature on an atomic scale, taking its starting point in mathematical models and quantum mechanics. supercodex [live set] begins subtly, with digital noise, blips and bass drones, from which gradually emerges the core elements of techno and dance music, where Ikeda uses raw data and mathematical models to generate music and projections. Don’t miss this extraordinary live performance, where the accompanying visuals add to the rich textures to merge the senses, creating an unforgettable experience. For more information please visit: http://www.ryojiikeda.com/archive/concerts/#supercodex_live_set Part of the Soundislands Festival http://soundislands.com/si15/

events.name: Conversations: “~sound:senses”
events.description: “~sound:senses” Saturday 22nd August 2015 2.15pm to 5.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE What is the colour of sound? Does the shape of the plate change the taste of the cake? This August, join us as leading artists and scientists in the fields of psychology, sound art, perception, and multimodal design come together to explore how sound acts as the glue connecting our sensorial experiences and interactions. Guest speakers include luminaries such as interaction designer, Stefania Serafin, crossmodality researcher Charles Spence, composer Joyce Beetuan Koh, filmmaker Daniel Belton, and psycholinguist Suzy Styles. Chairing the panel is ArtScience Museum Executive Director, Honor Harger. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, initiated by PerMagnus Lindborg with support from CLASS and ADM at Nanyang Technological University, the Italian Institute of Culture, and the Arts Council of New Zealand.

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Sunday 23rd August 2015 10am to 6.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE “~sound:senses” Sound is the medium that acts as the glue between the senses, intertwining hearing, vision and movement. This Sunday Showcase, we invite you to dive into a coral reef of artworks and scientific demonstrations by international artists and researchers who have mapped out crossmodal associations with touch, smell, feel, and taste. “~sound:senses” will feature sound installations, experimental films, robotic sculptures, mobile media, web audio solutions, as well as workshops on electroacoustic sounds led by experts. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, with support from Nanyang Technological University.

events.name: Virtual Reality for Retail and Advertising
events.description: It is evident that Virtual Reality is going to revolutionise a number of industries. This time we will be discussing how we going to apply Virtual Reality technology to Advertising and Virtual Retail. Imagine the possibility of setting up storefront just like how we create websites like html now. So as, hire a virtual shopkeeper for your virtual storefront. Imagine the possibility to curate a virtual building of all the rooms, just like orchard road. Each room is a virtual shop in the building. Imagine the possibility to bring your possible customer to place or experience that you want them to experience to advertise your product. Such as taking your customer to taste a glimpse of Japan before showing them the Japan tour package. The $22tn retail industry is for us, the Virtual Reality Enthusiast to explore and set pace. Being able to simulate the real shopping experience whilst in the comfort of their own home is another big step from the present online shopping experiences. And for marketers looking to VR / AR as a way of delivering richer brand experiences, we’ll look at examples from Nissan, Castrol, Marriott Hotels, Dior and Patron. So let discuss and share about what can we, the VR Enthusiast brings to this market. We would also be having a speaker to share about : • How agencies and brands are starting to apply VR / AR technologies to their advertising and marketing efforts - Don Anderson, Regional Managing Director, We Are Socia @whateyeread • MetaRoom markup for Virtual Retail - Jia Hen, CEO of VRcollab @wizztjh Agenda 7.00 pm - Networking/ interesting VR video or link sharing/ Introduction 7.30 pm - Speaker's talk 8.30 pm - Networking
events.location: #03-04, IDA labs @ National Design Centre,  #03-04, 111 Middle Road, 188969, Singapore
events.group_name: SGVRAR - SG Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality meetup

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (August)
events.description: How is everyone feeling after RDRC? As we approach the third-quarter of the year, it's time to start consolidating and practising what we've learnt! As usual, we will have a structured workshop syllabus to facilitate learning for the beginners. For those who have been attending our meetups regularly and/or know the basics of Ruby on Rails, our flexibility will still be there. If you'd like to work on your project or run through concepts/material with guidance, our coaches are more than happy to help and answer your questions. We love the enthusiasts! Come and join us at the August Rails Girls meetup! Agenda: • 10:00 - 10:15 Registration • 10:15 - 10:20 Introduction • 10:20 - 10:30 Break into groups • 10:30 - 13:00 Start to code ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please contact Nathania (nathaniawong89@gmail.com) and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Sherwyn - Ted - Sai - Aravindh - Lachlan Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Winston (winston.yongwei@gmail.com).

events.name: Introduction to Automation with Selenium
events.description: Please register here... Hands on Test automation series We are happy to invite you to the second edition of vodQA on Saturday August 29th, 2015 at the ThoughtWorks Singapore office. vodQA (Value Oriented Discussion for Quality Analysts), a forum where testing enthusiasts get together, network and collaborate on the latest developments in the world of software testing. So far, we have successfully hosted more than 20 editions of vodQA across all ThoughtWorks India offices. And now, the most successful testing un-conference is making its debut in Singapore. Introduction to Automation with Selenium This workshop is intended to impart a basic knowledge of Automation and Selenium. A robust hands-on experience setting up Selenium, simple tests, sessions on debugging tests and executing them will be the key takeaways. This edition is going to be an interactive workshop where you will get selenium exposure from basics to hands-on. This vodQA aims at getting you up-to-speed on how to start using Selenium. NOTE: Registration is free for all and food will be provided. Please bring your own laptops for the event. *Limited seats - Confirmation of attendance will be sent by separate email shortly. Please register here...
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #012
events.description: Paper #1 - Worker/Wrapper/Makes It/Faster: Laurence Day : http://www.cs.nott.ac.uk/~jph/wwmf.pdf Paper #2 - Robust Range-Only Beacon Localization : Ashish Raste - https://people.csail.mit.edu/teller/pubs/robl.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: Gazelle Twin and Special Guests 10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 FREE This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents. Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin. Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”. Joining Gazelle Twin will be a carefully curated selection of audio visual and electronic artists from Singapore to present an evening of the most innovative and imaginative breaking sounds from the UK and Singapore underground. FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already. After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you. Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that. Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week! What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. ** DISCLAIMER **: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
